questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are implementing Dynamics 365 Customer Service for a call center. There are separate queues for level1 and level2.
You need to set up the queues to meet the following requirements:
✑ Users must have their own queues that no one else can access.
✑ Users must not be able to view each other's queue.
✑ Users must be able to work from the support queue.
Solution:
✑ Set up each user queue to be private.
✑ Set up level1 and level2 queues to be public and add applicable members.
✑ Set up the support queue to be public.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Set public Queues and add applicable members doesn´t make sense because all users have access to all public Queues.
Correct. Users must have their own queues that no one else can access means DEFAULT PERSONAL QUEUES. Then change them to private queues that can be access by designated users for what?

it means users from level 1 shouldn't view queue list from level 2.

A public queue can be view by everyone in organisation.

The correct solution should be :

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are implementing Dynamics 365 Customer Service for a call center. There are separate queues for level1 and level2.
You need to set up the queues to meet the following requirements:
✑ Users must have their own queues that no one else can access.
✑ Users must not be able to view each other's queue.
✑ Users must be able to work from the support queue.
Solution:
✑ Set up each user queue to be public.
✑ Set up level1 and level2 queues to be public and add applicable members.
✑ Set up the support queue to be public.
Does the solution meet the goal?

A company has a service level agreement (SLA) that they will get a call back from the call center within three business days.

The call center regular hours are Monday through Friday 8:00 a.m.-11:00 p.m. Eastern time.

The call center is closed on New Year's Day and the day after New Year's. New Year's Day is on a Thursday this year.

The company calls for support on the Tuesday before New Year's Day at 8:00 a.m.

You need to determine the call center's deadline for the SLA.

When will the call center miss their SLA?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the right answer

Selected Answer: A
Ticket raised: Tuesday before New Year.
SLA three days.

So as per SLA 3 Business Days are:
1. Tuesday (before New Year)
2. Wednesday (before New Year)
-New Year (Thursday is holiday)
-Day after New Year (Friday is holiday)
by right the Satuday is the third business day as no mention of weekend closure. Even if Weekend is closure based on asssumption, then by right the third business day is Monday after New Year which is Answer A, right?

Why is it mentioned as C?

comments.content: Sorry it is mentioned as A) Monday 8M which is the third day of the SLA and it is not over as it is the beginning of the day. So by right answer C) is the right answer. My bad.
Great explanation. So answer is C: Tuesday

discussion.content:
The question is asking when will MISS the SLA.
Tuesday 8:00 - Tuesday 17:00 1BD
Wednesday 8:00 - Wednesday 17:00 1BD
Thursday paused timer
Friday paused timer
Monday 8:00 – Monday 17:00 1BD
Tuesday 8:00 miss SLA
So the answer is Tuesday.

comments.content: Why not Monday (tuesday, wednesday and monday are 3days)?

choices.B: The Friday after New Year's Day at 8:00 a.m. Eastern time
choices.A: The Monday after New Year's Day at 8:00 a.m. Eastern time
choices.C: The Tuesday after New Year's Day at 8:00 a.m. Eastern time
choices.D: The Saturday after New Year's Day at 8:00 a.m. Eastern time

choices.E: The entitlement is set as the default
choices.B: The entitlement is in waiting status

questions.question_text:
A customer’s entitlement is not available to assign to a case.

You need to determine the cause of the customer’s issue.

What are two possible reasons for the issue? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
